Gideon Berridge

Web developer

About

Who am I?

A London (UK) based web developer open to working locally or remotely. I’ve always been drawn to where technology and creativity collide which is why I am passionate about web development.

Where did I come from?

I started off in the music industry working as a musician, promoter and sound engineer and later on as a video editor and AV technician on corporate events.

My journey into tech

I’ve always had a passion for learning and technology. I studied an MA in Creative Sound and Media Technology and had made several Wordpress sites to promote music projects though it was after working on an event for the Raspberry Pi foundation that I got really hooked. I delved into the maker culture and taught myself Python and C++ whilst making several projects using Arduino’s and Raspberry Pi’s. Feeling the need for web development skills beyond basic Wordpress, I enrolled on a 6 month intensive web developer bootcamp at Le Wagon. By this time time I was utterly hooked on the challenge of coding and thoroughly determined to make a career change. I have been freelancing as a web developer since completing the bootcamp in September 2021.

Projects

Vinyl Tracer

Ruby on rails / SCSS / PostgreSQL / Bootstrap

Working prototype of a music suggestion app that uses real world music trivia events to connect acts via web scraping and API's.

Refuge

A working static website for a band. Features include viewing videos in full screen, streaming tunes and links to purchase tickets for shows.

Uses lazy loading, sticky header, slider and image delay.

Natours

Advanced CSS animation and hover effects.

Mapty

A running and cycling workout app that accesses Leaflet API.
